section.title: DESCRIPTION
section.para: The varnishstat utility displays statistics from a running varnishd(1) instance.

listitem.para: Instead of presenting a continuously updated display, print the statistics to stdout.

varlistentry.term: Field inclusion glob. A field glob consists of three parts,

listitem.para: type, ident and name, where ident is optional. Each part can contain a '*' character at the end to match a prefix. Use backslash to escape characters. If the argument starts with '^' it is used as an exclusion glob. Multiple -f arguments may be given, and they will be applied in order.
Lists the available fields to use with the -f option.
Specifies the name of the varnishd instance to get logs from. If -n is not specified, the host name is used.

varlistentry.term: Specify a the filename of a stale VSM instance. When using

listitem.para: this option the abandonment checking is disabled.
Display the version number and exit.
Wait delay seconds between updates. The default is 1. Can also be used with -1, -x or -j for repeated output.
Displays the result as XML.
Displays the result as JSON.

section.title: CURSES MODE
section.para: When neither -1, -j or -x options are given, the application starts up in curses mode. This shows a continously updated view of the counter values, along with their description.
The top area shows process uptime information.
The center area shows a list of counter values.
The bottom area shows the description of the currently selected counter.

section.title: Columns
section.para: The following columns are displayed, from left to right:

listitem.para: The name of the counter
The current value of the counter.
The average per second change over the last update interval.
The average value of this counter over the runtime of the Varnish daemon, or a period if the counter can't be averaged.
The moving average over the last 10 update intervals.
The moving average over the last 100 update intervals.
The moving average over the last 1000 update intervals.

section.title: Key bindings
section.para: The following keys control the interactive display:

listitem.para: Navigate the counter list one line up.
Navigate the counter list one line down.
Navigate the counter list one page up.
Navigate the counter list one page down.
Go to the top of the counter list.
Go to the bottom of the counter list.
Toggle between showing and hiding unseen counters. Unseen counters are those that has been zero for the entire runtime of varnishstat. Defaults to hide unseen counters.
Cycle through the verbosity levels. Defaults to only showing informational counters.
Quit.
Sample now.
